intro: Aphanamixis elmeri, commonly known as the Elmer's aphanamixis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
